svg.title: 3. Map Link
svg.text: The link between education and industry today is more importnat than since ever. Local specific jobs and an early connection between the two sectors links the people more to their home-town and provides specialized workforce. Experienced people, who can give their knowledge to the following generations is cru-cial for the surviving of local industries.

The Marble industry produces large amount of waste during mining and processing stages. This waste is dumped on to open land which creates a lot of environmental problems. Not only for ecological reasons, but also in terms of reusing the very special and local material, the prolongation of the stone’s lifecycle is highly demanded.

The state of Norway wants the annual production volume of Aquaculture to at least quintuple until 2050. Some think that this is an utopic aim, but neverthe-less, the waters with the highest quality and most suitable for fish farming are located in Norway. Especially Fauske is connected to Skjerstadfjorden that is not exploited within its full potential.
